intro: Sphaerolobium, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a genus of flowering plants native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plants typically have compound leaves and produce pods that contain seeds. Sphaerolobium species are often found in various habitats, including woodlands and grasslands. They play an important role in soil enrichment due to their nitrogen-fixing ability.
